result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly A Donnell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Commit no new crimes which rise to a level of probable cause for arrest.  No contact with victim, Kohl's Department Store at S. 27th Street.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety, subject to random screens.
Participate in mental health assessment and treatment. Defendant to be evaluated for supervision through mental health unit. Take medications as prescribed.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court waived the DNA sample and costs.  DNA costs are waived due to defendant's inability to pay. Costs to be paid while on probation to convert to a civil judgment. Restitution is set at $0.
No firearms; weapons. Victim's voting righrs are restricted until they are restored.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly A Donnell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kimberly A Donnell in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Kimberly A Donnell in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for Nicholas Cerwin the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  State has satisfied victim notification.
Defendant sentenced to serve 10 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
      *   Commit no new crimes which rise to a level of probable cause for arrest.
      *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.
     *   participate in mental health assessment and treatment.
     *   defendant to be evaluated for supervision thru mental health unit.
     *   Take medications as prescribed.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety, subject to random screens.
     *   No contact with victim, Kohl's Department Store at S. 27th Street.
     *   Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
          victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
     *   Court waived the DNA sample and costs.  DNA costs are waived due to defendant's inability to pay
     *   Obtain and maintain employment.
     *   No firearms; weapons.
     *   Victim's voting rights are restricted until they are restored.
     *   Restitution is set at $0.
Costs to be paid while on probation to convert to a civil judgment. 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights, Ineligible Voting Rights form received and filed.
Attorney Terese M Dick in court, defendant Kimberly A Donnell not in court, in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M Dick in court, defendant Kimberly A Donnell not in court, in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Br 34 has no objection to transferring to br 6 for resolution with 13cf537.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Kimberly A Donnell not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kimberly A Donnell in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Kimberly A Donnell in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KOHL'S DEPARTMENT, 3737 S 27TH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kimberly A Donnell in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Kimberly A Donnell in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
